p: The EO of Piper arboreum, and specifically that obtained from the leaves, is on average dominated by sesquiterpenoids, particularly by sesquiterpene hydrocarbons and secondarily by their oxygenated derivatives; monoterpenoids only play a minor role. According to dos Santos et al. [ 74], the EO from the leaves contains 65.85% of sesquiterpenes, 22.59% as hydrocarbons and 43.26% as oxygenated derivatives, and only 4.28% of monoterpenes (see Table 14).
